Description: A large shawl, almost square. Made from the full weaving width of natural cream silk; predominantly tabby woven, but with one wide and three narrower twill woven bands at each warp end. Warp ends plied and knotted. Some staining in the middle.
Production place: Made in: Libya (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Tunisia (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Made in: Jordan (?: source: Sahar el-Sayed)
Curator's comments: Donations and Purchases Book Volume 9: 'Arab' and 'Five pieces comprising an Arab costume'; Asia Collections storage intake book: 'Middle East'. In the opinion of Sahar el-Sayed (textile curator, Cairo Textile Museum) these clothes are festive dress, worn by a man living in a rural environment. Garment worn with As1979,14 .1 jacket .2 waistcoat .3 coat .5 coat, 'abaya'
